item.title: aca_data_collection

item.title: ADMUR
item.description: Tools to directly model underlying population dynamics using chronological datasets (radiocarbon and other) with a variety of models, including Continuous Piecewise Linear (CPL) model framework, and model comparison framework using BIC. Package also calibrates 14C samples, and generates Summed Probability Distributions (SPD). CPL modelling directly estimates the most likely population trajectory given a dataset, using SPD simulation analysis to generate a Goodness-of-fit test for the best selected model.

item.title: aDRAC
item.description: The Archive des datations radiocarbones d’Afrique centrale (archive for radiocarbon datings from Central Africa, aDRAC) provides a catalogue of available radiocarbon dates from Central Africa. The data cover published radiocarbon dates and essential metadata for each date as well as available references.

item.title: adrsm
item.description: A tool designed to simulate the paired-end sequencing of a metagenomic community.

item.title: AIDA
item.description: Dataset of 4,010 radiocarbon dates from Italy from Late Mesolithic until Late Antiquity.

item.title: AIS
item.description: Archaeological Information System

item.title: Al2O3_AnalysisApp
item.description: Shiny app to analyse Al2O3:C measurements

item.description: Allen relations from Bayesian calibration: R function to compare two indefinite intervals produced by a Bayesian calibration using the Allen algebra.

item.title: allen.archaeology
item.description: Allen’s Interval Algebra for Archaeologists.

item.title: Alligator
item.description: A Web tool for converting CAs with dating information to relative time intervals as RDF.

item.title: analogue
item.description: Analogue and weighted averaging methods for palaeoecology.

item.description: The goal of this project is to spatially locate bibliographic resources regarding the archaeology of Anatolia (modern Turkey). item.title: ARK1

It includes data-editing, data-creation, data-viewing and data-sharing tools, all of which are delivered using a web-based front-end.

ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) is a web-based ’toolkit’ for the collection, storage and dissemination of archaeological data. It includes data-editing, data-creation, data-viewing and data-sharing tools, all of which are delivered using a web-based front-end.

item.description: An open call to edit and revise current typological assignments and attributes associated with diagnostic artifacts found across the National Forests and Grasslands in Texas (NFGT).

item.description: A repository listing Museums active on GitHub, written in Rstats.

item.title: GlobaLID-App
item.description: The GlobaLID web app

item.title: GlobaLID-database
item.description: Facilitates the reconstruction of raw material provenances with lead isotopes.

item.title: GmAMisc
item.description: A collection of functions that built in different points in time. The functions’ aim spans from univariate outlier detection, to permutation t test, permutation chi-square test, calculation of Brainerd-Robinson similarity coefficient, validation of logistic regression models, point pattern analysis, and more.

item.title: gods_on_the_barge
item.description: Inspired by the research project of historiography of ancient Graeco-Roman religions, the main goal is to spread a selected cult successfully across the ancient Mediterranean

item.title: gorbit
item.description: Making the freely available and excellent Orbis data just a little bit more easy to use.

item.title: GPRsuite
item.description: Shiny app for RGPR.

item.title: grainsizeR
item.description: This package contains all the tools necessary to extract grain sizes from images, digitally sieve grain size measurements, and gather descriptive statistics on sieved data.

item.title: grass-arch
item.description: A LaTeX textbook devoted to explain how archaeologists can work with GRASS GIS

item.title: grups
item.description: A collection of Python and R scripts that can be used to simulate the pairwise genetic distances between human individuals in a provided test pedigree.

item.title: hammurabi-markov
item.description: Simple VueJS page generating fake laws of Hammurabi.

item.title: hapROH
item.description: Software to call ROH from ancient and present-day DNA using reference haplotypes.

item.title: harris-matrix
item.description: Harris Matrix Visualization for the web using D3 + KLayJS-D3.

item.title: harris-matrix
item.description: Write Graphviz dot files for archaeological sequence diagrams and Bayesian chronological models.

item.title: harris-matrix-data-package
item.description: A Data Package specification for archaeological stratigraphy data following the Harris Matrix convention.

item.title: Harris-matrix-legacy
item.description: Create a Harris Matrix from archaeological stratigraphy data using Python and Graphviz.

item.title: harris2graph
item.description: harris2graph is a script to help migrate data from the LST file format used by the BASP Harris, Stratify and ArchEd packages into modern graph file formats.

item.title: heurist
item.description: A web-based data management infrastructure that allows researchers to design, create, manage, analyse and publish their own richly-structured database(s) through a simple web interface, without the need for programmers or consultants.

item.title: historical-geocoding-assistant
item.description: Tool for assisted geocoding of historical datasets (something between a manual table editing and automated geocoding script)

item.title: HOPS
item.description: A pipeline which focuses on screening MALT data for the presence of a user-specified list of target species.

item.title: hsv-api
item.description: Historical Street View API

item.title: HumanOS
item.description: A mobile application for the intuitive recording of human bones from archaeological sites.

item.title: iconr
item.description: Set of formal methods for studying archaeological iconographic datasets (rock-art, pottery decoration, stelae, etc.) using network and spatial analysis.

item.title: iDAI.field
item.description: The German Archaeological Institute’s (DAI) new take on a field research documentation system. Combining features of GIS, photo management, and database management systems in a unique and integrating manner, it aims at facilitating archaeological workflows by reducing the overhead of using multiple systems. Developed in-house by the DAI’s information technology department, it targets primarily the needs of the institute’s excavations, older ones as well as those to come. Yet, due to the nature of its adjustable data model and the fact it is open source software, any interested third party is free to reuse and adjust it to their needs.

item.title: idaifieldR
item.description: The goal of idaifieldR is to flexibly get data from the idaifield database into R.

item.title: Image enhancement process tool
item.description: This software implements five state of the art algorithms aimed to enhance the quality of underwater images.

item.title: inclusions
item.description: Shortcodes to describe inclusions in ceramic bodies.

item.title: input
item.description: Makes surveying geospatial data easy by designing your survey project in QGIS with custom forms.

item.title: IntCal
item.description: The IntCal20 radiocarbon calibration curves are provided here in a single data package, together with previous IntCal curves and postbomb curves.

item.title: IntChron
item.description: An indexing service for chronological information. Information can be viewed as webpages or downloaded as data files in different formats.

item.title: IOSACal
item.description: IOSACal is an open source tool for radiocarbon calibration

item.title: Iraq_mortar
item.description: Enables the creation of a high quality 3D model of an archaeological artefact via process known as photo-masking.

item.title: Isaac's List of FOSS tools for academics... and what to use them for!
item.description: An annotated list of open source tools for academics.

item.title: ishtar
item.description: Ishtar is a database project for managing archaeological data and documentation from archaeological operations, that prioritizes maximum traceability of the information. Designed to enable inter-database communication, the Ishtar project aims rather to a distributed information model than a centralized one: communication between the databases is favored.

item.title: IsoArcH
item.description: Open access and collaborative isotope database for bioarcheological samples.

item.title: IsoDataVis
item.description: Data visualization guidelines for stable isotopes graphs, with examples

item.title: IsoMapNL
item.description: Data and script to generate a map of the Netherlands for isotopic analyses

item.title: Isotope-Visualisation
item.description: Resources relevant to visualisation of isotopic results

item.title: italy-3d-amphitheaters
item.description: 3D amphitheatres.

item.title: ithaca
item.description: Restoring and attributing ancient texts using deep neural networks.

item.title: joint-disease-tool
item.description: Interactively guides the user through a number of questions, ending in a specific pathology diagnosis.

item.title: juliandate
item.description: Simple conversions between Julian Dates and Julian/Gregorian calendar dates, supporting ancient dates.

item.title: kairos
item.description: Analysis of Chronological Patterns from Archaeological Count Data.

item.title: katun
item.description: Tools for converting between Maya and Western calendars.

item.title: khroma
item.description: Colour Schemes for Archaeological Data Visualization

item.title: kidstats
item.description: Shiny application that provides subadult age estimations based on dental and skeletal development and skeletal diaphyseal metrics using pre-optimized mixed cumulative probit models.

item.title: Kmeans
item.description: Script for conducting K-means cluster analysis using R. This script provides output designed to help the user select an appropriate cluster solution.

item.title: kotyle
item.description: Calculate the capacity of a ceramic vessel, like an amphora.

item.title: kriging
item.description: Codes for performing kriging for ethnographic and archaeological data.

item.title: LA_ICP_MS-Routines_FMNH
item.description: Routines to read and analyze LA-ICP-MS data from the Field Museum’s Elemental Analysis Facility

item.title: Le Stratifiant
item.description: Application for creating stratigraphic diagrams and checking the consistency of the chronostratigraphic recording.

item.title: leastcostpath
item.description: Provides the functionality to calculate Least Cost Paths (LCPs) which are often, but not exclusively, used in archaeological research. This package can be used to apply multiple cost functions when approximating the difficulty of moving across a landscape, as well as taking into account traversing across slope and other costs such as landscape features. This package also provides functionality to validate the accuracy of the computed LCP relative to another path.

item.title: lecAAR
item.description: Tool for calculating the largest empty circles and estimation of archaeological sites theoretically to be expected in region of interest, an implementation of the method published by Andreas Zimmermann and Karl Peter Wendt (2003).

item.title: leeHom
item.description: Bayesian reconstruction of ancient DNA fragments.

item.title: levant-zooarch
item.description: Table of faunal analyses from archaeological sites in the Levant.

item.title: LISA
item.description: Moran’s I and Getis-Ord G* Analysis.

item.title: List of Resources for getting started with (teaching) digital methods
item.description: A short list of introductory resources on DH.

item.title: lithic3dslicer
item.description: .obj slicing for lithic 3d morphometrics.

item.title: Lithics3D
item.description: An R package for processing and analyzing 3D scans of archaeological lithics.

item.title: long-bone-diaphyseal-CSG-Toolkit
item.description: A GNU Octave toolkit for analyzing diaphyseal long bone cross sectional geometry.

item.title: Luminescence
item.description: Development version of the R package ‘Luminescence’. The R package ‘Luminescence’ by the R-Luminescence Group provides a collection of various R functions for luminescence dating data analysis.

item.title: LumReader
item.description: R package to simulate a Luminescence Reader

item.title: maacgis
item.description: Climate Response and Virginia Archaeology: Maps from Different Points of View

item.title: MADAM
item.description: Two-level de novo assembly strategy for ancient bacterial genomes.

item.title: magAAR
item.description: Analyse geomagnetic data from archaeological context

item.title: MALT
item.description: A sequence alignment and analysis tool designedfor processing high-throughput sequencing data, especially in the context of metagenomics.

item.title: Map Files
item.description: This page presents an ever growing collection of resources for digital mapping.

item.title: map-of-Ancient-Egypt
item.description: Known pyramids of Ancient Egypt using python + OpenStreetMap.

item.title: mapDamage
item.description: Tracking and quantifying damage patterns in ancient DNA sequences.

item.title: MapofComputationalArchaeology
item.description: Visualizes digital archaeology as a fantasy landscape.

item.title: mapping-iterative-assembler
item.description: Consensus calling (or “reference assisted assembly”), chiefly of ancient mitochondria.

item.title: marbleplan
item.description: Loading a Marble Plan fragment.

item.title: Mask_UAV
item.description: Software to annotate, train, using deep learning, and segment imagery data from UAVs or other platforms.

item.title: Mastodon-Archaeology
item.description: Simple web app that helps to bulk follow archaeologists on the FOSS microblogging service Mastodon.

item.title: Material Sources for Early Islam and Late Antique Near East
item.description: A list of resources and materials for research on the history of Early Islam and the Late Antique Near East.

item.title: MAX
item.description: An online tool for the comparative analysis of museum databases.

item.title: maximum-likelihood-relatedness-estimation
item.description: Infer biological relatedness from low coverage 2nd generation sequencing data.

item.title: maya-calendar
item.description: Tools for converting between Maya and Western calendars.

item.title: Mean-Ceramic-Date-and-Error-Estimation
item.description: Script for calculating mean ceramic dates based on tabular data. This script also estimates sampling error using a bootstrapping procedure.

item.title: measure3d
item.description: A simple qgis plugin that measures the 3d distance between two selected points.

item.title: meshlab
item.description: These tools are meant to help you render orthographic views of 3D models for archaeological publication by simplifying, segmenting, cleaning and rendering 3D meshes.

item.title: metabit
item.description: An integrative and automated metagenomic pipeline for analysing microbial profiles from high-throughput sequencing shotgun data.

item.title: mhbil
item.description: Code repository of the book by Oliver Nakoinz and Daniel Knitter “Modelling Human Behaviour in Landscapes – Basic concepts and modelling elements”.

item.title: missing
item.description: You have a sequence of numbered items and want to check if any are missing.

item.title: mortAAR
item.description: Analysis of Archaeological Mortality Data.

item.title: mpvecost
item.description: Provides the facility to calculate non-isotropic accumulated cost surface and least-cost paths using a number of human-movement-related cost functions that can be selected by the user. It just requires a Digital Terrain Model, a start location and (optionally) destination locations.

item.title: MtreeRing
item.description: A tool for automatically measuring tree-ring width using image processing techniques.

item.title: mudata
item.description: The mudata2 package provides tools to read, write, and document multi-parameter spatiotemporal data.

item.title: MultiVCFAnalyzer
item.description: A SNP filtering and SNP alignment generation tool, designed around (but not limited to) low coverage ancient DNA data.

item.title: munsell
item.description: Provides easy access to, and manipulation of, the Munsell colours

item.title: munsell-plot.R
item.description: Make a stratigraphic-style plot-schematic of sediment colour using munsell values

item.title: murature
item.description: This Python library was written as an help for the study of stone walls, mainly through the quantitative analysis of spatial dimensions of stones.

item.title: NAA analytical dashboard
item.description: Analytical Dashboard for conducting various analysis to group and assess groupings for Neutron Activation Analytical chemical compositional data

item.title: NASSA-modules
item.description: The modular library of the Network for Agent-based modelling of Socio-ecological systems in Archaeology

item.title: Near-Presence-Analysis
item.description: R script for analyzing presence/absence data in irregularly distributed archaeological survey units.

item.title: nearpresence
item.description: Implements Near Presence Cluster Analysis, a statistical method for identifying spatial clustering within presence / absence data observed in irregularly distributed areal observation units.

item.title: neiman1995
item.description: R Shiny Document - Visualizing model functions in Neimans ‘Stylistic variation in evolutionary perspective’ with an interactive document.

item.title: neolithicR
item.description: Shiny app to search and filter radiocarbon dates from various source databases, based on the R package c14bazAAR.

item.title: neotoma
item.description: Programmatic R interface to the Neotoma Paleoecological Database

item.title: NERD
item.description: Dataset of 10,647 radiocarbon dates from the Near East from the Late Pleistocene until the Late Holocene (ca. 14 - 2 kya BP).

item.title: nervia
item.description: Management system for physical storage of archaeological finds

item.title: nexus
item.description: Sourcing Archaeological Materials by Chemical Composition.

item.title: NgsRelate
item.description: Infer relatedness, inbreeding coefficients and many other summary statistics for pairs of individuals.

item.title: nimbleCarbon
item.description: The nimbleCarbon package provides utility functions and bespoke probability distributions for the Bayesian analyses of radiocarbon dates using the NIMBLE framework. The package is particularly dedicated to demographic inferences based on changing frequencies of radiocarbon dates.

item.title: non-metric-trait-analysis
item.description: A set of GNU Octave functions for biodistance analysis based on non-metric traits.

item.title: nonekXML
item.description: Exchange data format (XML) for NoNeK (Nordmitteleuropäische Neolithische Keramik).

item.title: NRHP_Metadata_Scheme
item.description: Metadata scheme for National Register of Historic Places, transcribed from the National Park Service NPS Bulletin 16

item.title: ODATE
item.description: An introduction to the issues, methods, and techniques of digital archaeology, integrated with working code and virtual computing environments or ’notebooks’ written in Python or R.

item.title: ODK-forms-archaeology
item.description: Forms for the Open Data Kit mobile data collection app.

item.title: ODKArchForms
item.description: Open Data Kit forms and conversion scripts used in archaeology. Including New Mexico LA Forms, photologs, etc

item.title: OHM Data Index
item.description: The data index considers a collection of research areas that broadly stroke an idea of the level of completeness in the knowledge of a given period and timeframe.

item.title: Open Access Archaeology
item.description: OpenAccessArchaeology.org is dedicated to helping people discover and use Open Access resources in the field of Archaeology.

item.title: Open Context Python Code Repository
item.description: This project represents the current evolution of Open Context. It’s intended to be an easier to maintain code-base, and to make the data published by Open Context easier to maintain.

item.title: Open History Map

item.title: open-archaeo
item.description: A list of open source archaeological software and resources.

item.description: Project to create community awareness of open science practices, provide training and establish a working group for open science.

item.title: OpenArchaeology.net
item.description: Open Archaeology hosts a number of sub-projects that while functional at a component level are intended to interoperate creating a complete AIS (Archaeological Information System), including the components necessary to manage the organisation carrying out the archaeology.

item.title: OpenAtlas
item.description: An open source, web based database system for complex archaeological, historical and geospatial data.

item.title: opencontext
item.description: An R API client for the Open Context archaeological data repository.

item.title: OpenLidarToolbox
item.description: A QGIS plug-in that provides one-step-processing of airborne LiDAR data from point cloud to LiDAR visualisations.

item.description: Plot data on skeletal templates quickly

item.description: Tools for osteometric sorting of human remains.

item.description: A simple app for tracing outlines of an irregular shape and exporting the coordinates of the outline.

item.description: An R package to derive outline shapes from (multiple) artefacts on JPEG images.

item.title: oxcAAR
item.description: A collection of functions that can be used to execute OxCal from within R.

item.description: A function for retrieving metrics for resistance-resilience from rcarbon permTest objects.

item.description: Global archaeological radiocarbon dataset

item.title: p3k14c-data-scrubbing
item.description: Scrubbing program for the global archaeological radiocarbon dataset

item.title: paleocar
item.description: An R package implementing functions to perform spatio-temporal paleoclimate reconstruction from tree-rings using the CAR (Correlation Adjusted corRelation) approach of Zuber and Strimmer.

item.title: paleocore
item.description: Towards a data standard for paleoanthropology.

item.title: paleocoreR
item.description: R package for interacting with the Paleocore API

item.title: paleofire
item.description: An R package to analyse sedimentary charcoal records from the Global Charcoal Database to reconstruct past biomass burning

item.title: paleomix
item.description: Pipelines and tools for the processing of ancient and modern High-Throughput Sequencing (HTS) data.

item.title: PaleoView
item.description: A visualization tool for paleoclimatic modeling data.

item.title: paleoxrf
item.description: The goal of paleoxrf is to simplify reading data from Acadia’s paleoenvironmental X-Ray Fluorescence laboratory

item.description: R Package to reconstruct paths using archaeological monuments, model parameters of infrastructure and evaluate those parameters, model parameters of infrastructure and evaluate those parameters.

item.description: A workflow for integrating ancient lineages into present-day phylogenies.

item.description: Protocol to vecotorize archaeological or architectonic legacy data.

item.description: Script to convert a folder of Dutch archaeological reports (PDFs) to XML files nested by section, chapter, heading.

item.description: Proto-Elamite sign list.

item.description: This is a collection of datasets for photogrammetry.

item.description: Photogrammetry tutorial.

item.description: Created for the very-specific purpose of communicating via android with a raspberry pi running a scanner.

item.description: Piwigo plugin for viewing 3D models using 3DHOP.

item.description: Pure Locational Clustering.

item.description: Distance matrices between islands normalised over Pleistocene time. A complete ground-up rebuild of PleistoDist for use with R.

item.description: tutorial on an intuitive way to visualise a dental inventory in a sample

item.description: Uses a Bayesian approach to construct age-depth models for 210Pb data.

item.description: Compute postmortem damage patterns and decontaminate ancient genomes.

item.description: An open-access database for geochemical sourcing of archaeological materials.

item.description: This simulation tool aims to help students and researchers to start to see what pollen looks like under the microscope, and start to identify common pollen grains.

item.title: poseidon-framework
item.description: Poseidon is a framework that seeks to provide standardized ways to store and share archaeogenetic, and perhaps more broadly, molecular archaeological datasets.

item.title: postAAR
item.description: An automated process to detect buildings within large sets of postholes in multi-occupational sites, similar to the obsolete Windows-software “posthole” by Irwin Scollar.

item.title: postAAR-python
item.description: Python implementation of postAAR.

item.title: Potential datasets for PhD projects
item.description: A Google Doc with different archaeological and anthropological datasets and resources for students who need to make changes to their project due to COVID-19

item.title: pred_map_tut
item.description: A tutorial for (archaeological) predictive mapping using r

item.title: predictSource
item.description: A package to analyze data used to determine whether samples from multiple sources can be separated, to predict the sources of samples from unknown sources, and to evaluation the validity of those predictions. Sample data can include both quantitative and qualitative data. The package includes functions for creating an analysis file from multiple files and exploratory data analysis, as well as multivariate statistical methods to determine source separation, predict sources of unknown samples, and evaluate the validity of the predictions (principal components, classification trees, and random forests).

item.title: profileAAR
item.description: python qgis plugin of recexcavAAR’s archprofile

item.title: pta_data
item.description: An open access digital archive of antique Christian texts.

item.title: pXRF
item.description: R package for processing pXRF data.

item.title: pyArchInit
item.description: A python plugin for QGIS aimed at managing data from archaeological contexts on the GIS platform

item.title: pygeoroc
item.description: Python library to access data in the GEOROC database.

item.title: PyPlum
item.description: Creates age-depth models using 210Pb data and autoregressive gamma process.

item.title: pypofatu
item.description: A python package to curate Pofatu data.

item.title: PyXRF
item.description: PyXRF is a python-based sophisticated fluorescence analysis package for fitting and visualizing X-ray fluorescence data

item.title: QField
item.description: A simplified touch optimized interface for QGIS.

item.title: QGIS-scripts
item.description: Some scripts that could be useful for QGIS users.

item.title: QGIS-topographic-networks
item.description: Models relationships between elements in a terrain model, connecting pixels according to their height difference.

item.title: QGIS-visibility-analysis
item.description: Calculates visible surface from a given observer point over a digital elevation model. The plugin is intended for more complex modelling, such as the depth below the visible horizon or generation of intervisibilty networks between groups of points. It is particularly performant for multiple viewshed calculations form a set of fixed points.

item.title: qrcode-storage
item.description: Scripts to create QR-Code images for storage boxes. Each box has an associated web page describing its content, and the QR-Code serves as a short-link from the physical object to the web page.

item.description: R Library for Quantitative Analysis in Archaeology.

item.description: Finding quantum in archaeological data using cosine quantogram and related statistical methods.

item.description: A database interface designed to facilitate the irregular, iterative, and non-linear workflows that are commonly employed in lithic analysis.

item.description: This contains a set of data about human mobility, subsistance, population, and environmental productivity derived from the Standard Cross Cultural Sample

item.description: The R package ‘RCarb’ provides a collection of various R functions to model dose rates in carbonate-rich samples. The package is a translation of the ‘MATLAB’ program Carb by Roger P. Nathan

item.description: Python wrapper for RGPR (ground-penetrating radar visualisation & processing).

item.title: RTIBuilder
item.description: A software interface to a set of tools that process your captured image set to produce the final RTI files. The RTIBuilder download includes the Hemispherical Harmonics (HSH) fitter to create .rti files.

item.title: RTIViewer
item.description: Enables you to view and explore Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI) files at very high resolution (Polynomial Texture Maps, Hemispherical Harmonics Map, and Multiview RTI). You can view image files stored on your local file system, and remote files through HTTP.

item.title: sdr33_triangulation
item.description: Reads an SDR33 data logger file and using the angular observations recorded therein to triangulate the position of points of interest.

item.title: sdsanalysis
item.description: dsanalysis is the backbone of the sdsbrowser webapp, and can be employed to analyse SDS stone artefact data in R.

item.title: sdsbrowser
item.description: sdsbrowser is an R Shiny WebApp developed to make the available SDS datasets (following the Systematic and Digital Documentation of Stone Artefacts recording system) more accessible. It is designed to give you a quick overview on the spatial and temporal scope of sites previously analysed with SDS and the distribution of artefacts within these sites.

item.title: SEAHORS
item.description: R Shiny application that allows easy and quick exploration of the spatial distribution of archaeological objects.

item.title: senscape
item.description: A toolbox for modelling human perception of topography for QGIS, based on QGIS viewshed module.

item.title: seriation
item.description: R package that provides the infrastructure for ordering objects with an implementation of several seriation/sequencing/ordination techniques to reorder matrices, dissimilarity matrices, and dendrograms (see below for a full list). Also provides (optimally) reordered heatmaps, color images and clustering visualizations like dissimilarity plots, and visual assessment of cluster tendency plots (VAT and iVAT).

item.title: Seriation
item.description: Algorithms, implementations, manuscripts, and test cases for iterative deterministic frequency seriation done by agglomeration.

item.title: Sériation de matrice en présence/absence
item.description: Excel file containing macro commands making it possible to transform a 1/0 table (presence / absence) into a graphic matrix treated by matrix permutations; it is possible to take into account the uncertain presence of a character. The instructions for use are contained in the file.

item.title: Seriographe EPPM
item.description: The EPPM serograph is a graphical tool for chronological serialization of archaeological furniture counting tables.

item.title: Sex.DetERRmine
item.description: Calculate the relative coverage of X and Y chromosomes, and their associated error bars, from the depth of coverage at specified SNPs.

item.title: SexEst
item.description: Uses machine learning models to predict the Sex of unknown skeletons based on their cranial and postcranial measurements.

item.title: shapAAR
item.description: This is an R package for the extraction, analysis and classification of (not only) archaeological objects derived from scanned images. Especially it aims at the analysis of the shapes/profiles of eg. ceramic vessels or arrow heads.

item.title: shiny_DRAC
item.description: graphical interface for DRAC

item.title: shiny_Tldating
item.description: Shiny app for TL dating

item.title: shkrdata
item.description: Package for downloading and preparing shkr data for archaeological analysis

item.title: shootpoints-web-api
item.description: Back-end and middleware for the ShootPoints Web total station surveying program.

item.title: shootpoints-web-frontend
item.description: User interface to the ShootPoints Web total station surveying program.

item.title: shoredate
item.description: Offers methods to shoreline date Stone Age sites located along the Norwegian Skagerrak coast based on their present-day elevation and the trajectory of past relative sea-level change.

item.title: signboardr
item.description: Extract text from archaeological photos containing a sign board and tag as metadata.

item.title: simple-browser-gis-collector
item.description: Mobile-oriented browser based application that could be used for data collection.

item.title: sindwem
item.description: This R package contains exactly one function, that calculates the “sum of individual weighted means” according to a methodology that is quite common among archaeologists and was first published in 1988 by Elisabeth Fentress and Philip Perkins.

item.title: sipontomedievale
item.description: This repo contains the code for an interactive website created to illustrate historical background, findings and data of the Siponto excavation site (Manfredonia, Italy)

item.title: sitedefinition
item.description: The goal of sitedefinition is to see how feature densities might be used for site definition.

item.title: skeletal-sex-estimation
item.description: A GNU Octave function for skeletal sex estimation.

item.title: skullanalyzer
item.description: A concrete way of extracting cranial mophometric features.

item.title: skyscapeR
item.description: An R package for data reduction, visualization and analysis in skyscape archaeology, archaeoastronomy and cultural astronomy.

item.title: snpAD
item.description: Implements an iterative method to jointly estimate error rates and genotypes frequencies from the data.

item.title: soiltexture
item.description: The Soil Texture Wizard is a set of R functions designed to produce texture triangles (also called texture plots, texture diagrams, texture ternary plots), classify and transform soil textures data

item.title: sparch
item.description: A set of extra utilities that extend the functionlaity provided by core packages for spatial data management and analysis in R.

item.title: SPARSE
item.description: Indexes >100,000 reference genomes in public databases in to hierarchical clusters and uses it to predict origins of metagenomic reads.

item.title: SPARTAAS
item.description: Statistical pattern recognition and dating using archaeological artefacts assemblages.

item.title: spDates
item.description: Analysis of spatial gradients in radiocarbon dates.

item.title: statuAAR
item.description: Estimation of human stature from long bone measurements according to several well established estimation formula.

item.title: Stratibase
item.description: Stratibase is a minimal field recording database application (currently in FileMaker FP7 format software), aimed at the simplest structure possible to perform the basic functions of a stratigraphic recording.

item.title: stratigraphr
item.description: R package for archaeological stratigraphy and chronological sequences.

item.title: strativerse
item.description: A collection of time-stratigraphic publications.

item.title: survey2gis
item.description: A little tool for processing survey data, such as produced by a GPS or total station, and export it as topologically cleaned data fit for use in GIS.

item.title: svg-pottery
item.description: A set of best practices, how-tos and implementations for publishing pottery drawings on the Web

item.title: swapdata
item.description: A collection of archaeological datasets and tools related to the prehistory of Southwest Asia.

item.title: synthkat
item.description: Synthetic Categories for Archaeological Vessel Comparison.

item.title: tabula
item.description: Analysis, Seriation and Visualization of Archaeological Count Data.

item.title: Tachy2GIS
item.description: Enables you to create geometries directly from tachymeter input while at the same time adding vertices manually.

item.title: Tachy2GIS_arch
item.description: QGIS plugin for documentation of archaeological features using Tachy2GIS.

item.title: tapas
item.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of any short read mapper and its parameters using artificially generated reads.

item.title: tavo-a27
item.description: Ancient animal occurrence data from Uerpmann 1987, The Ancient Distribution of Ungulate Mammals in the Middle East, TAVO A27.

item.title: tdar
item.description: R package that allows programmatic access to the Digital Archaeological Record (tDAR), a service of Digital Antiquity.

item.title: teaching-rome
item.description: A collection of texts, 3d models, and maybe other resources useful for teaching about the Roman Empire.

item.title: tfqar
item.description: Tools for Quantitative Archaeology - in R.

item.title: THANADOS
item.description: An open source, web application for the presentation of archaeological data especially for burial studies.

item.title: The ABM in Archaeology Bibliography
item.description: A selected yet comprehensive list of literature and resources on Agent Based Models (ABM) in Archaeology.

item.title: The AWOL Index
item.description: This publication systematically describes ancient-world information resources on the world-wide web. The bibliographic data presented herein has been programmatically extracted from the content of AWOL - The Ancient World Online (ISSN 2156-2253) and formatted in accordance with a structured data model.

item.title: The Southwestern Taphonomic Protocol
item.description: A set of analyses to control for variable taphonomic impacts on archaeological faunal datasets.

item.title: tidypaleo
item.description: This package simplifies a few workflows when working with multi-proxy paleo-archive data

item.title: timeperiod2daterange
item.description: Converts time period entities to standardised date ranges.

item.title: tipom
item.description: TIPOM is based on a methodology that was developed in the 1960s by Bernardino Bagolini. The basic idea is to use the three simple dimensions of length, width and thickness of each lithic artefact to classify them in discrete groups and infer their function.

item.title: tkgwv2
item.description: An ancient DNA relatedness pipeline for ultra-low coverage whole genome shotgun data.

item.title: Tldating
item.description: R package for TL dating

item.title: Tools for Quantitative Archaeology
item.description: Keith KintighTools for Quantitative Archaeology TFQA, is a package of more than 45 PC programs developed to satisfy several unusual analytical needs of archaeologists.

item.title: TOPAS
item.description: A toolkit for efficient manipulation of sequence data in various ways.

item.title: tosca
item.description: Tool for Online Seriation and Correspondence Analysis.

item.title: total-station-manuals
item.description: Manuals for total stations

item.title: totalopenstation
item.description: Total Open Station downloads and exports survey data from your total station.

item.title: totalopenstationToQgis
item.description: A plugin to connect with totalopenstation software developed as part of the IOSA project.

item.title: totalstation-tools
item.description: Tools to use and manipulate total station data

item.title: TPQ-Composer
item.description: Utility for graphically displaying a set of termini post quem induced from stratified archaeological artifacts.

item.title: TRANSIT
item.description: GIS toolbox for estimating the duration of ancient sail-powered navigation.

item.title: TransmissionBias
item.description: Includes an agent-based model (ABM) of cultural transmission that simulates the three main forms of transmission bias: content bias, frequency bias, and demonstrator bias.

item.title: tRauma
item.description: Interactive graphical user interface to aid in the interpretation of blunt-force rib trauma in forensic anthropology casework.

item.title: trenchdrawer
item.description: Plugin for drawing trenches.

item.title: tridas
item.description: TRiDaS is a universal data exchange standard for the dendrochronology community. This project contains the data standard itself as well as libraries and tools useful for reading, writing and converting dendro data files.

item.title: tutorials
item.description: Tutorials on quantitative archaeology.

item.title: tweet-edits-to-archaeology-articles.R
item.description: Using R with wikipedia for various things

item.title: UnconstrainedClustering
item.description: Unconstrained Clustering.

item.title: UniformProbabilityDensityAnalysis
item.description: R implementation of the Uniform Probability Density Analysis approach

item.title: unstruwwel
item.description: Detect and Parse Historic Dates in R.

item.title: UThwigl
item.description: Compute closed- and open-system uranium-thorium (U-Th) ages of geological and archaeological samples.

item.title: vegan
item.description: R package for community ecologists: popular ordination methods, ecological null models & diversity analysis.

item.title: vegan3d
item.description: Dynamic and static 3D plotting for vegan.

item.title: Vessel-Measuring-Tool
item.description: Digitize archeological drawings of vessels in order to calculate their capacity and weight.

item.title: villager
item.description: A framework for creating and running agent based models in R. Its purpose is to provide an extensible framework where modeling can be done in native R.

item.title: vitutr
item.description: A page for video tutorials on R, specifically for archaeology

item.title: web_geochemistry
item.description: Visualizing XRF and NAA geochemistry concentrations.

item.title: xDateR
item.description: Shiny app for interactive crossdating of tree-ring data.

item.title: xraylib
item.description: xraylib is a library containing over 40 functions to be used to retrieve data from some of the most respected databases of physical data in the field of X-ray

item.title: xrf
item.description: The goal of xrf is to provide tools to read, plot, and interpret X-Ray fluorescence spectra

item.title: xronos.R
item.description: A worldwide database of chronological information from archaeological contexts, including radiocarbon and dendrochronological data.

item.title: xylib
item.description: ylib is a portable library for reading files with x-y data from powder diffraction, spectroscopy, or other experimental methods

item.title: yada
item.description: yada, which stands for Yet Another Demographic Analysis package, supports a variety of demographic tasks, with most applications drawn from forensic anthroplogy and archaeology.

item.title: zooaRch
item.description: The zooaRch package provides analytical tools to make inferences on zooarchaeological data.

item.title: zooaRchGUI
item.description: The zooaRchGUI package provides a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to analytical tools for zooarchaeological data in the R package.

item.title: zoolog
item.description: Manipulate log-ratios (also known as log size index (LSI) values) from measurements obtained on zooarchaeological material.
